H.RES.9
Latest Title: Instructing certain committees to report legislation replacing the job-killing health care law.
Sponsor: Rep Dreier, David [CA-26] (introduced 1/5/2011)      Cosponsors (8)
Related Bills: H.RES.26
Latest Major Action: 1/20/2011 Passed/agreed to in House. Status: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 253 - 175 (Roll no. 16).
Latest Action: 1/20/2011 Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
House Reports: 112-1
Jump to: Summary, Major Actions, All Actions, Titles, Cosponsors, Committees, Related Bill Details, Amendments
SUMMARY AS OF:
1/20/2011--Passed House amended.    (There are 2 other summaries)

Requires each of the following House Committees to report to the House legislation, within its jurisdiction, proposing specified changes to existing law (including the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act): (1) the Committee on Education and the Workforce; (2) the Committee on Energy and Commerce; (3) the Committee on the Judiciary; and (4) the Committee on Ways and Means.

MAJOR ACTIONS:

1/5/2011 Introduced in House
1/6/2011 Reported by the Committee on Rules. H. Rept. 112-1.
1/20/2011 Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 253 - 175 (Roll no. 16).
ALL ACTIONS:
1/5/2011:
Referred to the House Committee on Rules.
1/6/2011 11:52pm:
Reported by the Committee on Rules. H. Rept. 112-1.
1/6/2011 11:52pm:
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 1.
1/6/2011 11:53pm:
Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 26 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2 and H. Res. 9. Measure provides for consideration of H.R. 2, as amended, with the amendment printed in Part A of the report. H.R. 2, as amended, shall be debatable in the House for seven hours, equally divided and controlled. Measure provides for consideration of H. Res. 9 which shall be considered as read, debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled, and makes in order the amendment printed in Part B of the report.
1/7/2011 11:03am:
Rule H. Res. 26 passed House.
1/20/2011 9:14am:
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 26. (consideration: CR H361-373; text of measure as reported in House: CR H361)
1/20/2011 9:14am:
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2 and H. Res. 9. Measure provides for consideration of H.R. 2, as amended, with the amendment printed in Part A of the report. H.R. 2, as amended, shall be debatable in the House for seven hours, equally divided and controlled. Measure provides for consideration of H. Res. 9 which shall be considered as read, debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled, and makes in order the amendment printed in Part B of the report.
1/20/2011 9:15am:
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 9.
1/20/2011 10:30am:
H.AMDT.3 Amendment (A001) offered by Mr. Matheson. (consideration: CR H371-373; text: CR H371)
Amendment directs the committees of jurisdiction over health care legislation to enact a permanent fix to the flawed Medicare sustainable growth rate formula used to determine physician payments under the Social Security Act.
1/20/2011 10:30am:
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H.Res. 26, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Matheson (UT) amendment.
1/20/2011 10:36am:
H.AMDT.3 The previous question was ordered on the amendment (A001) and the resolution pursuant to the rule. (consideration: CR H372)
1/20/2011 11:00am:
H.AMDT.3 On agreeing to the Matheson amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 428 - 1 (Roll no. 15).
1/20/2011 11:08am:
On agreeing to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 253 - 175 (Roll no. 16).
1/20/2011 11:08am:
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

AMENDMENT(S):

1. H.AMDT.3 to H.RES.9 Amendment directs the committees of jurisdiction over health care legislation to enact a permanent fix to the flawed Medicare sustainable growth rate formula used to determine physician payments under the Social Security Act.
Sponsor: Rep Matheson, Jim [UT-2] (introduced 1/20/2011)      Cosponsors (None)
Latest Major Action: 1/20/2011 House amendment agreed to. Status: On agreeing to the Matheson amendment Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 428 - 1 (Roll no. 15).
